page.title: 08Le Jerriais
page.content:
{Le Jerriais} (original) Le Jerriais est ecirt dans la langue locale, connue "le Jerriais".Ch'est pus souvent les vielles gens qui l'paslent.Le pus grande partie des Jerriais paslent en Angliais, et a l'ecole l's efants sont seul'ment appunts le Francais. Ch'est principal ment dans les paroisses de la campagne qu'il est pasle, ch'est umque a jerri.
{Jersey French} (translation) The paragraph above is written in the local patois known as Jersey French.It is mostly spoken by the older people.Most of Jersey people speak in English and children are only taught ordinary French at school. It is mostly spoken in the country parishes especially in St Ouen.It is unique to Jersey.
